TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConfigurationRegistrar extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Allows derived configuration classes for entities and complex types to be registered with a .
Docs.remarks: Derived configuration classes are created by deriving from or and using a type to be included in the model as the generic parameter. Configuration can be performed without creating derived configuration classes via the Entity and ComplexType methods on .

Docs.param: The complex type configuration to be added
Docs.summary: Adds an to the . Only one can be added for each type in a model.
Docs.returns: The same ConfigurationRegistrar instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar AddFromAssembly (System.Reflection.Assembly assembly);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar AddFromAssembly(class System.Reflection.Assembly assembly) cil managed

abstract member AddFromAssembly : System.Reflection.Assembly -> System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar override this.AddFromAssembly : System.Reflection.Assembly -> System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.ConfigurationRegistrar

Docs.param: The assembly containing model configurations to add.
Docs.summary: Discovers all types that inherit from or in the given assembly and adds an instance of each discovered type to this registrar.
Docs.returns: The same ConfigurationRegistrar instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: Note that only types that are abstract or generic type definitions are skipped. Every type that is discovered and added must provide a parameterless constructor.
